English
Mary receives a letter from Matthew's effects, naming her as his sole heir and
therefore the owner of half the estate. Encouraged by Violet she agrees to
shadow Tom and learn more about the running of Downton and its surrounding
properties. Edna makes an inauspicious start as Cora's maid but soon forms an
alliance with Thomas to discredit Anna. Anna herself accompanies Rose to a
tea-dance in York for servants, where Rose, pretending to be a maid, attracts
gardener Sam Thawley but also provokes a fight so that a hurried exit is
required as the police arrive. Later Sam turns up at Downton Abbey and Rose,
dressed as a house-maid, lets him down gently by claiming that she has a
boyfriend. Isobel learns that Carson fell out with Charlie Grigg many years
earlier over a love triangle but effects a reconciliation before Grigg leaves
for work in Belfast whilst John dupes Molesley into accepting a much-needed gift
of money and Jimmy takes Ivy to her first theatre trip.
